classification.label: Earle Toppings Collection
classification.Contributing Unit: Victoria University in The University of Toronto
classification.Source Collection Description: Series consists of records relating to the Canadian Poets on Tape and Canadian Writers on Tape projects at the Ontario Institute for Studies in Education. Includes correspondence with Canadian poets and novelists (Al Purdy, Sinclair Ross, Margaret Laurence, Earle Birney, Dorothy Livesay, etc...) re taping procedures and arrangements, and distribution; compact discs containing audio recordings of readings and interviews. Materials range from 1969u20132008, but predominantly from 1969u20131971

classification.label: Victoria University in the University of Toronto

Rights.notes: Copyright Ontario Institute for Studies in Education

Location.notes: *Implied location based on information found in the James Reaney item
Location.venue: Ontario Institue for Studies in Education (OISE)
Location.address: 252 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M5S 1V6

Related_Works.citation: Toppings, Earle, and Anne Urbancic. Literary Titans Revisited: the Earle Toppings Interviews with CanLit Poets and Writers of the Sixties. Dundurn, 2017.

Item_Description.title: Canadian Writers on Tape: Hugh Garner
Item_Description.title_source: Canadian Writers on Tape: Hugh Garner

Material_Description.accompanying_material: No covers for both authors but there are two sheets of paper. One is for Richler which is a reflection after the interview along with extra information about his life. The second sheet is Garner which has background information, his role in CBC and television. Lastly, saying how he was a gambler in writing Canadian novels

Material_Description.other_physical_description: Writing on the Tape saying Garner Side 1 and Callaghan Side 2
